question: Does oncogene-induced DNA replication stress inhibit genomic instability?
ideal_answer: No, oncogene-induced DNA replication stress is thought to drive genomic instability.

snippets.text: Oncogene-induced DNA replication stress is thought to drive genomic instability in cancer.

We propose that single-stranded DNA generated in response to oncogene-induced replication stress compromises the repair of deaminated cytosines and other damaged bases, leading to the observed SNS mutator phenotype.
